title: ［學界］D1泳賽 喇沙飛魚莫啟迪破香港紀錄

replies.msg:
勁呀喂！D1學界泳賽岀現香港新紀錄！男子A Grade 200米蛙泳本來已是今天焦點大戰，由喇沙書院吳宇軒和莫啟迪上演兄弟內訌 ，游完100米後莫啟迪已經大幅領先，最後以2分16秒34首名觸池，除了比學界紀錄2分19秒73快3秒有多外，更打破師兄楊顯浩在今年4月創下的2分16秒90香港紀錄 ，亦成功達到2018年青奧的A標。

賽後莫啟迪與吳宇軒在水中擁抱，盡顯兄弟情 ，他更留下不少說話給予這位好兄弟:「考DSE要加油，希望考完之後可以繼續練水，之後再鬥過。」經歷過一段低潮，莫啟迪在今年學界重新岀發，個人刷新兩個學界紀錄兼一個香港紀錄，他坦言自己有更大的目標：「我會爭取代表香港岀戰亞運，而今天的成績亦達到青奧A標，之後會再在100背和200混合四式可達標。」

La Salle College Old Boys’ Association
Round Table Dinner
Guest Speaker: Mr. Frank Chan陳帆(1975), JP
Secretary for Transport and Housing運輸及房屋局局長
“What makes Hong Kong Great”


Date and Time: Wednesday, November 15, 2017 (6:30 p.m. to 9:30 pm)
Venue: World Trade Center Club 38/F, World Trade Centre, 280 Gloucester Road, Causeway Bay, Hong Kong

Regular Individual OBA Member Ticket @HK$700
Regular Individual Non-OBA Member Old Boys @HK$900
Note: Non-OBA member old boy can get a HKD200 credit towards your LSCOBA membership fee if you apply for membership on the spot.

Round Table Dinner 2017 – “What makes Hong Kong Great”

Mr Frank Chan陳帆, a senior old boy from class of 1975, is appointed Secretary for Transport and Housing運輸及房屋局局長on 1 July 2017. Before assuming this post, Mr Chan was the Director of Electrical and Mechanical Services and the General Manager of the Electrical and Mechanical Services Trading Fund since December 2011.

As the Secretary for Transport and Housing, Mr Chan is the Chairman of the Hong Kong Housing Authority, Hong Kong Maritime and Port Board, Hong Kong Logistics Development Council and Aviation Development and Three-runway System Advisory Committee. He is also a board member of the MTR Corporation Limited and the Airport Authority Hong Kong; as well as a member of the Council for Sustainable Development, Economic Development Commission and Task Force on Land Supply.

Mr Chan is a fellow of the Hong Kong Institution of Engineers and the Institution of Mechanical Engineers. Mr Chan received his bachelor’s degree in engineering from the University of Hong Kong, master’s degree in medical physics from the University of Aberdeen, UK, and master’s degree in business management from the University of Hong Kong. Mr. Chan contributed and participated in a number of School Improvement Projects for La Salle College.

LSCOBA is very pleased to have Mr Frank Chan (1975), JP, as the Guest Speaker for the Roundtable Dinner 2017. Tickets are sold on a first-come-first-served-basis. Please order your ticket(s) now by downloading and returning the form here.

For enquiry, please write to raysun2005@gmail.

Mr Chan is a fellow of the Hong Kong Institution of Engineers and the Institution of Mechanical Engineers.
